intro: Cochinchinochloa braiana, commonly known as the Borneo sedge, is a grass-like plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Cochinchinochloa braiana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
